intro: Carpodinopsis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered carpetweed, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences near the base of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Carpodinopsis uniflora is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions.
